website_summaries.verdict: The response of runners when the Ultraventure was released was overwhelmingly positive. This addition to the global roster of Topo Athletic running shoes was hailed as a reliable companion for the trails. The durability of the components, the steadiness of the midsole and the well-ventilated upper became the elements that caused people to appreciate the whole package. On the other hand, a handful of people claimed that there was some tightness when the foot rested in the interior chamber.The Topo Athletic Ultraventure is a trail shoe that’s meant for both neutral pronators and fans of stability running footwear.
pros: The traction capacity of the Topo Athletic Ultraventure’s outsole unit was lauded for being precise and dependable
The midsole’s multiple densities protected the foot from sharp surfaces and debris, according to several consumers
Some testers commented that the breathability of the upper unit was agreeable
they didn’t feel any buildup of stuffiness while wearing this product
The inner sleeve was soft and comfortable, according to a handful of testers
Blisters and hot spots apparently didn’t become a problem for them
Most purchasers commended the color schemes of this shoe, stating that the various hues were appealing to the eyes
Runners were happy with the durability of the Ultraventure
the materials didn’t wear off or tear apart quickly
cons: A few consumers complained that the Topo Athletic Ultraventure was a bit narrower than what they were used to

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long time Altra user. I switched to Topo due to wear issues . So far these shoes are wearing great. I love the vibram sole, great traction. The fit is perfect, my heel stays put. The insole is holding its cushion. I run on rocky trails and no issues with no rock plate. No problems with stream crossing - dry out quickly. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Ultra runner

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Altra Lone Peak. While I like the shoe the top material always felt flimsy and not supportive. I read a review on the Topo Athletic Ultraventure Trail Running Shoe and decided to try the shoe. I love it. While not zero drop it is minimal. The shoe is comfortable and the material used on the body of the shoe is very supportive. Now of course this is my opinion. As with any shoe what feels good on my foot may not be right for you. But if you have a local store that stocks the shoe I would recommend trying on a pair to see if you like them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H

customer_reviews.title: New Favorite Trail Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: The Topo Athletic Ultraventure Trail running shoe is a cross between my previous trail runners, the Altra Lone Peak 4.5 and the Hoka Speedgoat 3. The Topo Ultraventure gives you the roomy toebox of the Altra but it has more cushioning than the Altras and Less cushioning than the Hoka Speedgoats but overall i find it more comfortable and more responsive. I'm 60 years old so my feet appreciate the padding but I still like to feel connected to the trail. these are the Goldilocks selection of the trail running shoes as they are "just right" for me
customer_reviews.author: Dave Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I have walked an average of 4 miles per day for a total of 120 miles on blacktop / gravel / concrete sidewalk and already the tread is nearly bare. At this rate, the shoes will be worn out in another month. The shoes are comfortable and add good support, but I think they should last longer than 200 miles.
customer_reviews.author: JH.

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I do not use these shoes to run trails; I do wear these shoes for walking around and could not be more pleased with the comfort and support. My shoe size is 11.5 M; these shoes are true to size and the wider toe box is a great feature. I previously purchased a pair of Topo Magnifly 2 shoes based on the comfort rating in Runners World. I would rate the Magnifly 2 at four stars; the Ultraventure gets five stars for having similar characteristics but superior support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weird fit
customer_reviews.text: May be fine if it fits you. Has nice amount cushion. The traction is decent as well. But the problem is the fit. It is bulky. My foot just "rotates" within the shoe. This gives a horrible unstable feeling on even minor climbing. If I go half size lower, its not as loose but then toe hits the end of shoe (i.e., short on length). I am going to try thicker socks or insert to make it work but Topo is not for me.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable running/hiking/trail running shoes I've ever owned. I am almost 70 years old and the cushioned ride is very important to me. As my wife said, 'It's like walking on pillows'. The large toe-box is very nice, and the Vibram soles have great traction. I'll buy them again and again and again! Good design job Topo.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence of Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: Really nice shoe with a wide toe box as noted by others, but alas not wide enough for my foot — usually take a 3E or 4E, available in a few brands like New Balance.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H

customer_reviews.title: Best fitting athletic shoe I ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a perfect fit for my feet. I am wide at the toes, narrow at the heal. This is the first shoe of any type that fits me perfectly. They are also very light. I use them for walking. When walking, my step is now the best ever. The shoe matches my foot roll from heal through toe as I stride. I would recommend them to anyone needing a wide toe and narrow heal.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: This is a great trail shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable & ran my first 50 miler in them with no blisters after about 2 weeks of breaking them in.
customer_reviews.author: J & K Davis

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had these not quite two months. I've used then on the trails four times, 8 miles each occasion. The middle eyelet on the right shoe ripped off and, of course, the shoe is useless. Poor quality and poor quality control. I'm a Prime Amazon Member, I'm anxious to see how I fare when I ask for a credit or refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Solis

customer_reviews.title: Comfort for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Wide toe box fits my 4E feet perfectly, The OrthoLite insoles and Vibram outsoles are a super comfy setup with great traction. I am a big fan of These shoes and want to try some of Topo’s other kicks. They fit me better than Altra, and with better cushioning. I wish they made boots.
customer_reviews.author: ChiaBlue

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! Best out of my 4 pairs of Topos.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Bondor

customer_reviews.title: Easy ride
customer_reviews.text: I haven't done much running in the Topo's yet, but they seem very comfortable. An easy ride, quite light. Appear very well made. I'm thinking about getting the road running shoe as well.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Webb

customer_reviews.title: Toe box and cushion
customer_reviews.text: The wide toe-box is a godsend for my wide feet, and the cushioning is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Chibimie

customer_reviews.title: Stable lightweight trailshoe.
customer_reviews.text: This is really the best shoe from Topo Athletic. Light weight, good cushion with a good energy return (responsive) a vribram outsole makes this a perfect trailshoe. No rockplate but this really not needed in this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Marcel

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Use them more for hiking than running. I have a wider foot and appreciate the layout of the foot bed.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Great trail running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great trail shoe! My first Topo shoe and I’m very impressed with the comfortable, sturdy feel and ample toe box. Very stable on uneven ground, and with good traction.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Buy AMERICAN!!! Had to select star rating to submit?
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to support my arches with the ortholite insole and allow room for toesplay. Third pair that I have tried and they are a joke. For somebody that designed them as an AMERICAN he was quick to ship them off to China to be made!!!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: On my second pair. I wish they had more colors. They do seem to wear quickly, however they are comfortable and allow me to run on trails and some roads.
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Great fit so far
customer_reviews.text: Best fitting feel for my feet of any brands that I tried. Have not checked durability yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Topo yet
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. Very comfortable and seem stable in mud. Mud and dirt easily rinse off tread. Best one yet, I’ve used many different styles in this brand. Improved my runs for sure
customer_reviews.author: M. E.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Running Shoe for Large Framed Folk
customer_reviews.text: Shop around for your price. My first pair was over priced, still excellent shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bryant

product_meta.title: Topo Ultraventure Men-UK 10-Navy/Black
product_meta.description:
Topo Athletic Ultraventure is our newest addition to the Topo Athletic trail collection with features inspired by feedback from our trail and ultrarunners. 
Our 30/25mm stack height and 5mm drop features a 3-piece, multi-density EVA midsole that offers light guidance through the gait cycle. 
An aggressive Vibram XS Trek outsole provides traction, durability, and protection on technical trails. 
A fully gusseted tongue and an abrasion-resistant engineered mesh upper are optimized for breathability and strength, and feature drainage "gills" for water release and quicker drying. 
Ultraventure also features our uniquely ftted gaiter attachment, making it fully compatible with our stretch nylon Topo gaiter (optional and sold separately).

Specifications:
Weight: 11.2 oz (M9) 
Rubber Outsole: 6mm
Midsole: 19mm Eva (Heel) // 14mm Eva (Ball) 
Footbed: 5mm
Total Stack Height: 30mm X 25mm (5mm Drop) 

Discover the Topo Fit
Lightweight: Ultralight materials and seam-reducing construction techniques keep weight down and blisters at bay.
Roomy Toe Box: Plenty of room for the toes to spread and splay. A secure fit through the heel and midfoot allows the shoe to move with your body.
Low Drop: Topo cushioned midsoles are engineered with a 0 to 5mm heel-to-toe drop, encouraging natural loading and foot motion during the gait cycle.
feature_bullets: Anatomical toe box allows toes to spread naturally and comfortably
3-piece, multi-density EVA midsole for light guidance
Vibram XS Trek for traction, durability, and protection on technical trails
